alert.note: Alert for Monroe (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 16 at 6:27AM EDT until August 16 at 9:15AM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Buffalo has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Monroe County in western New York... * Until 915 AM EDT. * At 627 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated earlier thunderstorms produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain has fallen since Tuesday evening. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inch are possible in the warned area as only a few more showers are expected. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Rochester, Greece, Irondequoit, Hilton, Brighton, Gates-North Gates, Charlotte, Braddock Bay and Rochester General Hospital. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
